title: 105_hr2688
content: The Act titled "Economic Development Information Act of 1997" is declared in Section 1. Section 2 contains findings and declarations. The Economic Development Information Act of 1997 emphasizes the importance of accurate and timely information on economic development programs at the federal, state, and local levels. This information is crucial for supporting the national economy and addressing unemployment and underemployment in various regions. Previous efforts by the Economic Development Administration have been successful in providing such information. Congress declares the need to expand the provision of economic development information to assist all areas suffering from economic distress or long-term economic deterioration. This information should be accessible to various communities impacted by unemployment and underemployment. To maintain the national economy at a high level, economic development information should be expanded and accessible to all areas in need, providing access to various resources for economic development purposes. The Public Works and Economic Development Act of 1965 is amended to include a new section on the Office of Economic Development Information. This aims to expand and make economic development information accessible to all areas in need. The Secretary will establish an Office of Economic Development Information within the Economic Development Administration. The Office will serve as a central information clearinghouse on economic development programs, assist applicants in locating and applying for assistance, and develop connections to information databases from various government agencies. The Office of Economic Development Information will assist in locating and applying for development assistance under Federal, State, and local laws, and develop electronic links to information databases for identifying and applying for economic development programs. The Office of Economic Development Information will develop electronic links to databases containing information on available economic development programs at the Federal, State, and local levels, including key contacts, application processes, eligibility criteria, and economic data and trends. The Office of Economic Development Information will provide relevant information on State and local economic development programs, economic data and trends, case studies, technology utilization programs, and compilations of published works. The Office of Economic Development Information offers resources on economic development, technology programs, published works, revolving loan funds, finance programs, capital sources for businesses, and sustainable development initiatives. The Office of Economic Development Information provides resources for identifying capital sources for businesses, understanding sustainable development, and ensuring public access to data services. The Office of Economic Development Information provides accessible resources through various means such as an Internet website, toll-free telephone number, online electronic access, printed materials, and orientation workshops. The Office of Economic Development Information offers resources including direct phone access, online electronic access, printed manuals, orientation workshops, and on-call information specialists. The Secretary will collaborate with other federal departments to achieve the objectives of this section, with economic development defined to include economic adjustment, disaster recovery, industrial retention, and defense reinvestment. The Secretary will collaborate with other federal departments to coordinate the objectives of this section, including economic adjustment, disaster recovery, industrial retention, and defense reinvestment. Authorization of appropriations is provided for necessary funding.
